intro: Pistolochia × hausmannii var. samuelssonii, commonly known as the hybrid wax plant, is a flowering plant in the family Cucurbitaceae. It is a naturally occurring hybrid between Pistolochia hausmannii and Pistolochia samuelssonii, characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellow, lantern-shaped fruits that are covered in a waxy coating. It is native to tropical regions of South America and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance. The species is adapted to warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
